60 v8::internal::Isolate* isolate, T obj);

66class ApiFunction {
67 public:
68 explicit ApiFunction(v8::internal::Address addr) : addr_(addr) {}
69 v8::internal::Address address() { return addr_; }
70
71 private:
72 v8::internal::Address addr_;
73};

75class RegisteredExtension {
76 public:
77 static void Register(std::unique_ptr<Extension>);
78 static void UnregisterAll();
79 Extension* extension() const { return extension_.get(); }
80 RegisteredExtension* next() const { return next_; }
81 static RegisteredExtension* first_extension() { return first_extension_; }
82
83 private:
84 explicit RegisteredExtension(Extension*);
85 explicit RegisteredExtension(std::unique_ptr<Extension>);
86 std::unique_ptr<Extension> extension_;
87 RegisteredExtension* next_ = nullptr;
88 static RegisteredExtension* first_extension_;
89};

189class Utils {
190 public:
191 static V8_INLINE bool ApiCheck(bool condition, const char* location,
192 const char* message) {
193 if (V8_UNLIKELY(!condition)) {
194 Utils::ReportApiFailure(location, message);
195 }
196 return condition;
197 }
198 static void ReportOOMFailure(v8::internal::Isolate* isolate,
199 const char* location, const OOMDetails& details);
200
201#define DECLARE_TO_LOCAL(Name, From, To) \
202 static inline Local<v8::To> Name( \
203 v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::From> obj); \
204 static inline Local<v8::To> Name( \
205 v8::internal::DirectHandle<v8::internal::From> obj, \
206 v8::internal::Isolate* isolate);
207
208 TO_LOCAL_LIST(DECLARE_TO_LOCAL)
209
210#define DECLARE_TO_LOCAL_TYPED_ARRAY(Type, typeName, TYPE, ctype) \
211 static inline Local<v8::Type##Array> ToLocal##Type##Array( \
212 v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::JSTypedArray> obj); \
213 static inline Local<v8::Type##Array> ToLocal##Type##Array( \
214 v8::internal::DirectHandle<v8::internal::JSTypedArray> obj, \
215 v8::internal::Isolate* isolate);
216
217 TYPED_ARRAYS(DECLARE_TO_LOCAL_TYPED_ARRAY)
218
219#define DECLARE_OPEN_HANDLE(From, To) \
220 static inline v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::To> OpenHandle( \
221 const From* that, bool allow_empty_handle = false); \
222 static inline v8::internal::DirectHandle<v8::internal::To> OpenDirectHandle( \
223 const From* that, bool allow_empty_handle = false); \
224 static inline v8::internal::IndirectHandle<v8::internal::To> \
225 OpenIndirectHandle(const From* that, bool allow_empty_handle = false);
226
227 OPEN_HANDLE_LIST(DECLARE_OPEN_HANDLE)
228
229#undef DECLARE_OPEN_HANDLE
230#undef DECLARE_TO_LOCAL_TYPED_ARRAY
231#undef DECLARE_TO_LOCAL
232
233 template <class From, class To>
234 static inline Local<To> Convert(v8::internal::Handle<From> obj);
235
236 template <class From, class To>
237 static inline Local<To> Convert(v8::internal::DirectHandle<From> obj,
238 v8::internal::Isolate* isolate);
239
240 template <class T>
241 static inline v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object> OpenPersistent(
242 const v8::PersistentBase<T>& persistent) {
243 return v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>(persistent.slot());
244 }
245
246 template <class T>
247 static inline v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object> OpenPersistent(
248 v8::Persistent<T>* persistent) {
249 return OpenPersistent(*persistent);
250 }
251
252 template <class From, class To>
253 static inline v8::internal::Handle<To> OpenHandle(v8::Local<From> handle) {
254 return OpenHandle(*handle);
255 }
256
257 template <class From, class To>
258 static inline v8::internal::DirectHandle<To> OpenDirectHandle(
259 v8::Local<From> handle) {
260 return OpenDirectHandle(*handle);
261 }
262
263 private:
264 V8_NOINLINE V8_PRESERVE_MOST static void ReportApiFailure(
265 const char* location, const char* message);
266};
267
268template <class T>
269inline T* ToApi(v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object> obj) {
270 return reinterpret_cast<T*>(obj.location());
271}
272
273template <class T>
274inline v8::Local<T> ToApiHandle(
275 v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object> obj) {
276 return Utils::Convert<v8::internal::Object, T>(obj);
277}
278
279template <class T>
280inline v8::Local<T> ToApiHandle(
281 v8::internal::DirectHandle<v8::internal::Object> obj,
282 v8::internal::Isolate* isolate) {
283 return Utils::Convert<v8::internal::Object, T>(obj, isolate);
284}
285
286template <class T>
287inline bool ToLocal(v8::internal::MaybeHandle<v8::internal::Object> maybe,
288 Local<T>* local) {
289 v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object> handle;
290 if (maybe.ToHandle(&handle)) {
291 *local = Utils::Convert<v8::internal::Object, T>(handle);
292 return true;
293 }
294 return false;
295}

297namespace internal {
298
299class PersistentHandles;
300
301// This class is here in order to be able to declare it a friend of
302// HandleScope. Moving these methods to be members of HandleScope would be
303// neat in some ways, but it would expose internal implementation details in
304// our public header file, which is undesirable.
305//
306// An isolate has a single instance of this class to hold the current thread's
307// data. In multithreaded V8 programs this data is copied in and out of storage
308// so that the currently executing thread always has its own copy of this
309// data.
310class HandleScopeImplementer {
311 public:
312 class V8_NODISCARD EnteredContextRewindScope {
313 public:
314 explicit EnteredContextRewindScope(HandleScopeImplementer* hsi)
315 : hsi_(hsi), saved_entered_context_count_(hsi->EnteredContextCount()) {}
316
317 ~EnteredContextRewindScope() {
318 DCHECK_LE(saved_entered_context_count_, hsi_->EnteredContextCount());
319 while (saved_entered_context_count_ < hsi_->EnteredContextCount())
320 hsi_->LeaveContext();
321 }
322
323 private:
324 HandleScopeImplementer* hsi_;
325 size_t saved_entered_context_count_;
326 };
327
328 explicit HandleScopeImplementer(Isolate* isolate)
329 : isolate_(isolate),
330 spare_(nullptr),
331 last_handle_before_deferred_block_(nullptr) {}
332
333 ~HandleScopeImplementer() { DeleteArray(spare_); }
334
335 HandleScopeImplementer(const HandleScopeImplementer&) = delete;
336 HandleScopeImplementer& operator=(const HandleScopeImplementer&) = delete;
337
338 // Threading support for handle data.
339 static int ArchiveSpacePerThread();
340 char* RestoreThread(char* from);
341 char* ArchiveThread(char* to);
342 void FreeThreadResources();
343
344 // Garbage collection support.
345 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void Iterate(v8::internal::RootVisitor* v);
346 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE static char* Iterate(v8::internal::RootVisitor* v,
347 char* data);
348
349 inline internal::Address* GetSpareOrNewBlock();
350 inline void DeleteExtensions(internal::Address* prev_limit);
351
352 inline void EnterContext(Tagged<NativeContext> context);
353 inline void LeaveContext();
354 inline bool LastEnteredContextWas(Tagged<NativeContext> context);
355 inline size_t EnteredContextCount() const { return entered_contexts_.size(); }
356
357 // Returns the last entered context or an empty handle if no
358 // contexts have been entered.
359 inline Handle<NativeContext> LastEnteredContext();
360
361 inline void SaveContext(Tagged<Context> context);
362 inline Tagged<Context> RestoreContext();
363 inline bool HasSavedContexts();
364
365 inline DetachableVector<Address*>* blocks() { return &blocks_; }
366 Isolate* isolate() const { return isolate_; }
367
368 void ReturnBlock(Address* block) {
369 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(block);
370 if (spare_ != nullptr) DeleteArray(spare_);
371 spare_ = block;
372 }
373
374 static const size_t kEnteredContextsOffset;
375
376 private:
377 void ResetAfterArchive() {
378 blocks_.detach();
379 entered_contexts_.detach();
380 saved_contexts_.detach();
381 spare_ = nullptr;
382 last_handle_before_deferred_block_ = nullptr;
383 }
384
385 void Free() {
386 DCHECK(blocks_.empty());
387 DCHECK(entered_contexts_.empty());
388 DCHECK(saved_contexts_.empty());
389
390 blocks_.free();
391 entered_contexts_.free();
392 saved_contexts_.free();
393 if (spare_ != nullptr) {
394 DeleteArray(spare_);
395 spare_ = nullptr;
396 }
397 DCHECK(isolate_->thread_local_top()->CallDepthIsZero());
398 }
399
400 void BeginDeferredScope();
401 std::unique_ptr<PersistentHandles> DetachPersistent(Address* first_block);
402
403 Isolate* isolate_;
404 DetachableVector<Address*> blocks_;
405
406 // Used as a stack to keep track of entered contexts.
407 DetachableVector<Tagged<NativeContext>> entered_contexts_;
408
409 // Used as a stack to keep track of saved contexts.
410 DetachableVector<Tagged<Context>> saved_contexts_;
411 Address* spare_;
412 Address* last_handle_before_deferred_block_;
413 // This is only used for threading support.
414 HandleScopeData handle_scope_data_;
415
416 void IterateThis(RootVisitor* v);
417 char* RestoreThreadHelper(char* from);
418 char* ArchiveThreadHelper(char* to);
419
420 friend class HandleScopeImplementerOffsets;
421 friend class PersistentHandlesScope;
422};
423
424const int kHandleBlockSize = v8::internal::KB - 2; // fit in one page
425
426void HandleScopeImplementer::SaveContext(Tagged<Context> context) {
427 saved_contexts_.push_back(context);
428}
429
430Tagged<Context> HandleScopeImplementer::RestoreContext() {
431 Tagged<Context> last_context = saved_contexts_.back();
432 saved_contexts_.pop_back();
433 return last_context;
434}
435
436bool HandleScopeImplementer::HasSavedContexts() {
437 return !saved_contexts_.empty();
438}
439
440void HandleScopeImplementer::LeaveContext() {
441 DCHECK(!entered_contexts_.empty());
442 entered_contexts_.pop_back();
443}
444
445bool HandleScopeImplementer::LastEnteredContextWas(
446 Tagged<NativeContext> context) {
447 return !entered_contexts_.empty() && entered_contexts_.back() == context;
448}
449
450// If there's a spare block, use it for growing the current scope.
451internal::Address* HandleScopeImplementer::GetSpareOrNewBlock() {
452 internal::Address* block =
453 (spare_ != nullptr) ? spare_
454 : NewArray<internal::Address>(kHandleBlockSize);
455 spare_ = nullptr;
456 return block;
457}
458
459void HandleScopeImplementer::DeleteExtensions(internal::Address* prev_limit) {
460 while (!blocks_.empty()) {
461 internal::Address* block_start = blocks_.back();
462 internal::Address* block_limit = block_start + kHandleBlockSize;
463
464 // SealHandleScope may make the prev_limit to point inside the block.
465 // Cast possibly-unrelated pointers to plain Addres before comparing them
466 // to avoid undefined behavior.
467 if (reinterpret_cast<Address>(block_start) <=
468 reinterpret_cast<Address>(prev_limit) &&
469 reinterpret_cast<Address>(prev_limit) <=
470 reinterpret_cast<Address>(block_limit)) {
471#ifdef ENABLE_HANDLE_ZAPPING
472 internal::HandleScope::ZapRange(prev_limit, block_limit);
473#endif
474 break;
475 }
476
477 blocks_.pop_back();
478#ifdef ENABLE_HANDLE_ZAPPING
479 internal::HandleScope::ZapRange(block_start, block_limit);
480#endif
481 if (spare_ != nullptr) {
482 DeleteArray(spare_);
483 }
484 spare_ = block_start;
485 }
486 DCHECK((blocks_.empty() && prev_limit == nullptr) ||
487 (!blocks_.empty() && prev_limit != nullptr));
488}
489
490// This is a wrapper function called from CallApiGetter builtin when profiling
491// or side-effect checking is enabled. It's supposed to set up the runtime
492// call stats scope and check if the getter has side-effects in case debugger
493// enabled the side-effects checking mode.
494// It gets additional argument, the AccessorInfo object, via
495// IsolateData::api_callback_thunk_argument slot.
496void InvokeAccessorGetterCallback(
497 v8::Local<v8::Name> property,
498 const v8::PropertyCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info);
499
500// This is a wrapper function called from CallApiCallback builtin when profiling
501// or side-effect checking is enabled. It's supposed to set up the runtime
502// call stats scope and check if the callback has side-effects in case debugger
503// enabled the side-effects checking mode.
504// It gets additional argument, the v8::FunctionCallback address, via
505// IsolateData::api_callback_thunk_argument slot.
506void InvokeFunctionCallbackGeneric(
507 const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info);
508void InvokeFunctionCallbackOptimized(
509 const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info);
510
511void InvokeFinalizationRegistryCleanupFromTask(
512 Handle<NativeContext> native_context,
513 Handle<JSFinalizationRegistry> finalization_registry,
514 Handle<Object> callback);
